result.execSummary:
The defendant Donovan Demetrius Kingsby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 276 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: - Full time work, school or a combination.

- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- No contact with any Walgreens, CVS Pharmacy, Aldi, Advance Auto Parts, Clark Gas Station, PJG, and DJH. 
- No further violations of the law.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: - Pay mandatory costs, fees, surcharges, including DNA, out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donovan Demetrius Kingsby

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed: Original Transcript of Plea and Sentencing (56 pages) commencing 08-24-2022, by Lisa Diamond.

Defendant Donovan Demetrius Kingsby in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Donovan Demetrius Kingsby.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk cmt. 

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 


Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statements by : DW

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 5 years, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 276 days time served, the term of initial confinement is 1 1/2 years, the term of extended supervision is 3 1/2 years. 

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- Full time work, school or a combination. 
- No contact with any Walgreens, CVS Pharmacy, Aldi, Advance Auto Parts, Clark Gas Station, PJG, and DJH. 
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent. 
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, surcharges, including DNA, out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

1441B Jury Instruction

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Donovan Demetrius Kingsby not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. Court authorizes transfer of cases from Branch 01 for global resolution. State has no objection. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Donovan Demetrius Kingsby not in court, in custody.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2  room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Donovan Demetrius Kingsby in court with Attorney Ashley Fard; both appear by video.  Defendant Donovan Demetrius Kingsby in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer. M. Kowalik. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Pretrial Order, signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Advanced Auto Parts, PJG & JRT

DAR UNAVAILABLE DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIIES. CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Donovan Demetrius Kingsby in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Donovan Demetrius Kingsby in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donovan Demetrius Kingsby appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4)  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
